alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL, SOUTHWESTERN SANTA FE AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Albuquerque, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Albuquerque, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Edgewood, Tijeras, Cedar Crest, Sedillo, Sandia Heights, North Valley and Sandia Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 159 and 186. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 223 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area
